column3: > Where are the docs not displaying correctly?\n\nI'd also like to know this. Is there any other software that formats the markdown for display, besides github itself?
The `.` is part of the command, it shouldn't be removed.
It will be corrected in a future PR. I will try to articulate the issue better below.

The underlying issue is related to: https://help.github.com/en/articles/creating-and-highlighting-code-blocks#fenced-code-blocks

The syntax highlighting isn't standard markdown.
This is creating an inconsistency with markdown interpreters. The GitHub interpreter seems to correct this (probably because the error is very common). 

I will be happy to correct them because it isn't isolated
